title: Transformation of Continuous Random Variables
contentHtml:
The Jacobian method is a powerful tool to transform continuous random variables.

Given a function g(x), we can find the probability density function (PDF) of Y=g(X) using the Jacobian method.
intuition: The Jacobian method helps us find the PDF of Y=g(X) by relating it to the PDF of X. This is useful in machine learning when we need to transform data.

title: Transformation of Continuous Random Variables
contentHtml:
In probability theory, transformations of continuous random variables are crucial in many applications, including machine learning and artificial intelligence.

This theorem provides a powerful tool for analyzing such transformations.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves applying the change of variables formula and using the chain rule to compute the Jacobian.

intuition: This theorem allows us to transform a continuous random variable X into another variable g(X) while preserving its probability distribution.
realWorldApplications: Transforming features in machine learning models
